website_summaries.verdict: A compact, mechanical keyboard that is easy to travel with.
pros: Features a red backlight, multimedia and volume keys, and the ability to assign macros to any key
The compact, lightweight design makes it easily portable
cons: The backlight can be a little too bright and the keys are louder than many other mechanical keyboards

customer_reviews.title: Lasts for at least 1.5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: So I was sent this item by mistake when I ordered a different item, but I figured I'd leave a review anyway. For the 1.5 minutes that I held this keyboard in my hands, I have to say it felt pretty great. It didn't break in that amount of time so I would say its durability is pretty good, and it was quite easy to clean the 5 specs of dust that collected on it before I put it back in its plastic wrap. I pressed a total of 5 keys on it and the cherry mx reds live up to their hype. From my experience, pretty good, just not what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Potatoes

customer_reviews.title: Nice RGB, not too clicky
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small RGB mechanical keyboard for game play and this keyboard is everything I wanted/needed. Nice tactile response to the keys without making a lot of obtrusive sound. Love the customizable rgb lighting. Lots of options to play with there with Corsair's software, which seems to work pretty well. I use this on a iSkelter gaming lap board and have plenty of room for my mouse on the right and my Razer speedpad on the left. That sits on the arms of my easy chair. My monitor is on a swing arm attached to the side table. Picture included.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good but false advertising ?
customer_reviews.text: The missing stars are for false advertising, in the photos it shows that there are extra textured caps but i received only the keyboard and one of the main factors i chose this keyboard was that it comes with those extra caps Contacted amazon and didnt receive any reply. On the plus side the keyboard is silent pleasent to use, and the build quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: SMD

customer_reviews.title: Very good build quality, Switches, and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very satisfying to type on and works amazing for gaming. The wrist rest isn’t no leatherette one like i have on my razer keyboard but it actually isn’t uncomfortable at all, i get around the same comfort level as i do on my razer. the only thing i will say is stupid is the price, this keyboard costs more than it’s bigger brother (k70) so id say only buy this version of you strongly feel you want/need a tkl keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Luke F

customer_reviews.title: defective product, the f9 key is missing
customer_reviews.text: defective product, the f9 key is missing and it comes in a package that is not original, I do not recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Jesús s M. Hernández

customer_reviews.title: badass keyboard. simple, small form factor and very durable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: this is now my favorite keyboard. please note the buttons are loud, very loud, serious keyboard clacking sounds, so if ya not into that avoid it. i use this for customer tech support. my last keyboard i had made no sounds when you pressed buttons, even if i smashed them. i'm on the phone all day with customers and trust me, they wanna hear your keyboard clacking because it makes them feel like you are working for them, sounds = work being done to address the complaint. otherwise i dont think i'd use this at home as it does make a lot of noise but other than that product seems well made
customer_reviews.author: John Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want red RGB or non at all
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than clicky green and blue switches, but I still got O rings for it. It goes perfectly with my red and black build, so why pay more for rainbow throw up? There are 4 settings for brightness; off, dim, brighter, brightest (which is extremely bright). I only use it for gaming, so no need for the keypad either. It has some weight to it and is impressively sturdy and actuation seems great too. Was also ranked #1 in best keyboards under $75 on a Linus Tech Tips video! I managed to get it on sale for $60, but it looks like it went up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Huge for a TKL board, mediocre performance.
customer_reviews.text: For a TKL board Corsair sure found a way to make it huge. If you're looking to get a ten key less board your probably wanting to save space. Well Corsair found a way to make this board as large as possible. It's got large bezels and there's an extra row of multimedia keys that makes the keyboard much deeper than other TKL boards. As for switches they're fine. The action feels like two plastic pieces sliding against each other so it feels okay but I think Cherry MX switches are overrated, especially since they command a price premium. Also, Corsair keyboards have nonstandard bottom rows so if you're wanting to have the option to replace keycaps definitely look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: A great Cherry MX keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love my $350 Fujitsu RealForce PFU Topre 45-gram Silenced keyboard, but this keyboard types just as fast and accurately for 20% of the price. This keyboard is very solidly built and an excellent value. I only stick with my $350 keyboard because it is much quieter than a Cherry MX keyboard and it is easier on the fingers for long typing sessions, such as being a writer, coder, or chat support specialist. Also, I greatly prefer the genuine Cherry MX keys that Corsair uses compared to the ones that Razor switched over to. Finally, this compact form factor will be great if you're a lower sensitivity FPS player with a larger mouse pad, such as when sniping.
customer_reviews.author: John Needham

customer_reviews.title: Review for Corsair K63 lux
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard makes me never want to buy Corsair products again. The keycaps just fall off randomly while gaming. Caps lock is my voice for Discord/teamspeak/mumble and it will randomly just pop off mid gaming. If you don't click the direct center of it, it WILL pop off. The RGB lighting ONLY works when you turn it on in the software, not when you initially boot your computer. I could look past that though but the keycaps popping off mid gaming while in a competitive game where pausing is impossible is just retarded. Again, makes me never want to buy Corsair again it's beyond frustrating. $125 keyboards should not be made with such crap quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality product. I wish the usb cable is detachable.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that I'm a MX-Brown or MX-Blue. I tried the MX-Blue (different keyboard) and I hated how noisy it was so I went with MX-Brown keys for many years. I needed a compact keyboard with a win-key and -I think- this was the only one available with a volume roller. So what happened? I fell in love with the MX-Red keys. MX-Brown was nice and fun to type on... but the MX-Red is unbelievably comfortable to type on. I hate the software because I don't trust it. Rarely a key gets stuck (software issue) but it happens about once or twice a month and I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: SEV.

customer_reviews.title: horse poop quality, 3 keyboards in 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: my first k65 had started dying after 1 year, some keys were falling off and double pressing or not working, they didnt honor warranty. bought a second one last month and it completely died in less than a month. hopefully i get a refund. now i have to buy a 3rd one for $50 more
customer_reviews.author: Your mom

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as butter
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is exactly what I was looking for. I love the tenkeyless design without sacrificing useful keys, the sturdy build quality, the buttery smooth key presses, and the backlighting is great as well. The switches are exactly what I wanted, no click noise, but has a great feel. Also having volume buttons is a nice touch! One thing I will mention thats not really negative, but the wrist-rest is basically useless to me. I don't know if i have large hands or what, but my wrist doesn't touch it at all when gaming (wasd keys). It's very nice that I can just take it off and enjoy the extra desk real estate.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Icue software is completely broken.
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard but I paid extra for rgb. Icue software is broken for my Corsair commander and my keyboard. I would avoid that software. The leds would at least turn on before I installed it. still no fix. Corsair has just given up on supporting thier devices. The only option they give is to ship them the keyboard and commander pro. I refuse to be without my devices for months because their software is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget TKL Keyboard Option
customer_reviews.text: A nice upgrade from my old full-size Logitech G810. The TKL size is better for my desk, though it take some getting used to at first. I kept reaching for the 'Enter' key that usually comes on the numberpad. Keys feel great to press, very linear and smooth, and of course a bit different from Logitech's Romer G switches. I'm especially impressed with how balanced the keys feel to press, especially the space bar. Even though the switches are Cherry MX Red, I feel like I've already had a solid typing experience with this board even without tactile feedback or an audible click. All in all, a great budget upgrade if you're looking for a TKL gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Syed Omair

customer_reviews.title: Doubles on some keys
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this keyboard very much, but testing in notepad and I get multiple doubles on letters just typing a sentence. Also, it has 2 USB connecting to the PC, one should be enough. The added USB port on the keyboard is nice, but not something I would normally require. Other than the occasional double letters it's an overall good keyboard. Maybe I'm not hitting the keys hard enough or letting my finger press for too long getting the doubles, will put it on my main gaming PC for a harder test.
customer_reviews.author: zranktor

customer_reviews.title: A Good Quality Compact Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: There aren't very many frills on this keyboard, which actually makes it a pleasure to use. Key actuation is satisfyingly positive; no hesitation like you find on membrane switches. The media keys do exactly what they're programmed to do, and with Corsair's iCue software it's easy to choose an LED configuration. Since the backlighting on this model is only red, you're losing some of the aesthetic compared to an RGB model. Compact is certainly the way to describe this, so if you want a number pad or a set of programmable macro keys then there are better options. This is a good choice for light typing work, FPS games, and simple RPGs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard - But only offers 1 backlighting color option, red
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is very sturdy, feels great while typing and crams a lot of functionality into a small space. Some reviewers incorrectly suggest that it offers multiple backlighting color options. It doesn't. It uses Corsair's iCue software, but the software can only provide variations and effects on the only color this keyboard offers, red. FWIW, I'm finding the red backlighting easier to see and use than my previous Corsair keyboards many colors. But, still, be aware that this is a very good, albeit one color, keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Purvin

customer_reviews.title: would be a great keyboard except for these garbage keycaps
customer_reviews.text: While the switches on this keyboard are great, the keycaps are garbage. After a few days of moderate usage various keycaps will just pop off when being used. I could never hit the capslock key without it just popping off so I replaced the keycap with one from an old keyboard and now it works. Other then the garbage keycaps, the shape, size, look and feel of this keyboard are all great.
customer_reviews.author: wiccatech

customer_reviews.title: not the best, but still amazing
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard itself looks great, but the font is still incredibly bold which I don't like. this keyboard is no where near as bright as a razer keyboard and is actually very dim. the keycaps also feel cheap and plasticy but I plan on changing these out sooner or later. the cherry mx red switches are very rigid and not nice at first, but it takes a while for the switches to get smoother. the custom set of gaming keycaps that came with this keyboard would have been amazing had they not had an awkward curve and instead had the same size as the regular keycaps. other than that this keyboard looks incredible with its metal back plate.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got it at a discounted price so your mileage may vary but I'd say wait for a deal to be honest. It's a great keyboard and the lighting is almost infinitely customizable. Plenty of places that you can get lighting profiles for the device. Nice typer as well. Space bar seems a little heavier than a regular Cherry Red for some reason but I got used to it. Coming from the K70 so this is a good keyboard by any standard. Keycap lettering is a bit too large in my opinion. Swapped my K70 keycaps with this one so I'd recommend you do it too (if it bothers you.)
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Soundarajan

customer_reviews.title: Need a S/W running in background for lighting effect
customer_reviews.text: I like the H/W itself a lot, but needing a S/W running in background all the time for light effects is a big letdown. With their proprietary S/W, iCUE, you can save the static lighting configuration in the keyboard, but not lighting animations. What a disappointment. Even much cheaper keyboards handle dynamic lighting by itself these days. Except that, it's a solid keyboard, and I really like how it feels at my fingertips.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jung

customer_reviews.title: Apparently the best thing since sliced bread.
customer_reviews.text: Five shining, RGB stars from the teenager with the gaming rig. And just like a cuttlefish in flight mode, it pulsates in unison with its surroundings (surroundings being the same branded mouse) so what's not to like. Heavy AF and clicky just like the Model M from back in my day, so props for that. Probably just as expensive too. But better, because it looks like a Civic with a NOS sticker and one of those illuminated ground effects kit. It's got lights, man!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was interested in trying out a mechanical and it was listed as a quiet version. I didn't find it quiet at all. The switch actuation is quiet, but the key caps are far off the board and depressing one all the way while typing forces the plastic to hit the aluminum frame making too much noise for my taste. My other issue is with the wrist rest. It's hard plastic with a soft touch coating. The soft touch coating does nothing for actual resting comfort so it's totally useless. It's also about an inch too shallow and was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Revell

customer_reviews.title: CORSAIR TAKE MY MONEY
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Amazing keyboard. Its small and compact, perfect for gaming. The way that the keys sit on the mechanical components of the keyboard make it super easy to remove but they don't fall off easily like other keyboards. The lighting effects are cool and you can customize them to do all kinds of neat things. Typing on it is not too loud. Because the keys are not inlaid into the structure of the keyboard, its super super easy to clean and keep clean. The keyboard even comes with optional keys to swap out for the WSAD for textured ones. Best keyboard I have ever owned, 0 complaints after more than a month of use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to replace my old Razer Blackwidow keyboard from many years ago. In short, these keyboard is nice and compact without the unnecessary numpad buttons. It's also extremely durable and responsive and the added keys are a really nice touch. To top that off the cable is braided and the keys are RGB! Love love love this product.
customer_reviews.author: SlickRick

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one, do not be scared by 'gaming' keyboard from the title
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The 'Cheery-Red' was introduced by my co-worker, a software engineer, and after I tried his, I just have to buy one my self. Everyone should have a Cheery-Red keyboard. It is so comfortable to type. Do not be scared by 'gaming' keyboard from the title, it is a super keyboard for the business users. My wife is a real estate broker and she told me she wants one too. Get it when it is on-sale.
customer_reviews.author: linux168

customer_reviews.title: I bought the wrong keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Corsair RGB wireless keyboard. The battery, however, died in less than two years. So, when I bought this keyboard I thought it was wireless, too. My mistake!!! Also, it uses only Cherry MX Red buttons. It's a solid keyboard, one I would put against the Corsair. But it doesn't always light immediately, especially when I am booting or waking the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Linux
customer_reviews.text: Linux doesn't recognize this on boot so you have to constantly unplug it and plug it back in. Also one of of LEDs died within a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, I used to have the Razer black widow tournament and I love this more because of the key switches and aluminum build. It’s also easier to clean Edit: This keyboards RGB lights break pretty quickly and they stop allowing you to change the color they're supposed to; if you look it up, it's a pretty common problem with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Thought I wanted a tenkeyless
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tenkeyless keyboard to save desk space. THEN I realized how much I missed some of those keys, AND the volume wheel. so I returned this, and bought the full width version with the right side keys. If you are sure you will not miss the right side keys, go for it -- otherwise this is a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: RRW

customer_reviews.title: Died in 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I am writing on my phone cause this keyboard died after 9 months of usage. It is really loud on each stroke don't recommend unless you have your own game room. For casual use without number pad is inconvenience. The light are still working but it's own software and windows dont recognize it anymore. Gamming Mouse still working.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for space concerned
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for space focused setups and living room couch gaming. I love gaming from my couch since working from home and the space saving aspects and low profile k65 allows me to use the rest of the space for streaming. Keys are smooth and cleaning the keyboard is easy. The palm rest is comfortable and removing it allows another 3 inches of space.
customer_reviews.author: nuk

customer_reviews.title: Real cool when keyboard lights to metro exodus gameplay :)
customer_reviews.text: Pros: lights can turn off, brightness levels = 3, RGB lighting & especially when your game lights to gameplay action or QTE's & only lights the key ya need to press :) iCUE software is awsome. Solid keyboard. USB pass through :) Cons: none yet. I due miss the roller volume control but not a con just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: chobbes

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: Cherry MX Red - Great switch, quick response, and not too loud. RGB - A lot of cool settings to give that nice color to your set up. Material - Great materials, base made of metal, nice looking keyboard. It doesn’t feel cheap at all. Overall - I recommend the K65 for gamers who is looking for a great keyboard in the price range of $80 - 130 This keyboard offers a great switch, material, and RGB system for an insane price.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme

customer_reviews.title: Keys sinking? K63
customer_reviews.text: I think my "a" and "d" keys are sinking as they are significantly lower than the "s" or "f". Currently, they're about the same height as the ZXC row (which are tiered lower). It's possible that this is part of the design and I'm just now noticing it, but these two keys probably get hit the hardest. If I discover otherwise, I'd probably increase the rating to 4/5.
customer_reviews.author: Fra

customer_reviews.title: More Room On My Desk
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a full sized mechanical gaming keyboard that just took up too much room. I don't use the the number pad anyway so going keypadless to recover desk space was a no brainer. The keyboard's feel is excellent and works great for typing or gaming. Unfortunately it does not come with gaming WASD keycaps but they are easy enough to replace with a set of first person shooter caps (not included).
customer_reviews.author: DangFineGuy

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros : - Great lighting and customize ability - Good value ( I bought this for for around $70) - convenient media buttons Cons: - very thick and stiff cable that lies in the middle of the keyboard, makes it really hard to manage around your set up - get dusty very quickly, the surface is not 100% smooth so it's harder to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Duc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Good until switches start failing
customer_reviews.text: Good, while it works. The optional keycaps, ergonomics, software, and performance are all nice. However, after about 9 months of use, switches started failing. My F key and A key started failing or doubling intermittently. Since it's intermittent, I thought my typing/gaming was just off, but after swapping out to a new keyboard I'm typing perfectly again. It's disappointing since the initial experience was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin N. Nishikawa

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a good keyboard with only a little bit of sound as the key is depressed all the way down but it is not overly noisy or clicky like a lot of mechanical keyboards thanks to the MX cherry red switches it has. It was made even better by the fact that I got it on sale for only $50.
customer_reviews.author: Will J

customer_reviews.title: Woops
customer_reviews.text: The first hit was so good but you never get that same feeling after that. Two months after purchasing I started experiencing key ghosting. At times keys would completely stop responding and would require I unplug and replug the keyboard in. Great keyboard for my needs when it worked but didn't last long enough. Edit:: the above review was meant for another keyboard. This one is the cats pajamas so far and it hasnt let me down in game yet. Compact and affordable with cool RGB settings.
customer_reviews.author: HotPepsi

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard 👍
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about this keyboard at all. Feels great typing and gaming. Bought it as a second keyboard during the work from home period and as a keyboard to travel with. Instead this will be replacing my primary Ducky keyboard, which works out since the Corsair is pretty heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Hatt

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard much more than my razer
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard much more than my razer. The keys aren't clicky, but I found I like that much better. They're super smooth to the touch when you type them. They flow so well sometimes it feels like my hands want to type faster than my brain can keep up. The lighting effects are also really nice. I keep mine on the rainbow spiral setting. Gives off a very cool, but playful ambiance.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Vanderbeck

customer_reviews.title: Switching from another great Corsair keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a k68 for the last year and opted for the k65 because I loved my old keyboard, but the ten key made it a bit bulky with my desk setup. The per key lighting on this keyboard is amazing, and the build quality even surpassed the k68 which I've always felt was a perfectly adequate keyboard. I was a bit shocked to see the price for tenkeyless has gone up since I bought my first mechanical keyboard, but after seeing the build quality of the k65 lux, along with the excellent lighting control, and little extras like premium feeling wrist rest, and bonus textured gaming key caps, I can happily say I am impressed by this product.
customer_reviews.author: MereBear

customer_reviews.title: Works great out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Works great out of the box, all the switches feel consistent and the media button layout is sensible. I'm not a huge fan of the red switches personally as it makes typos a bit harder to catch while typing but as a primarily gaming keyboard it works great. Taking off one star because I feel like they cheaped out a bit going with a plastic body instead of metal like the full size k70 model.
customer_reviews.author: John park

customer_reviews.title: Its a nice compact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: What grabbed my attention about this particular keyboard is the compact size of it, for me it means I'd have more space to work around with my mouse which is a huge factor if using low sens low dpi, the quality's nice and it works as promised though keep in mind nothing's flawless and everyone has their own taste of products, as for complaints I got none besides the dust that piles up on it quickly though warning if you're a heavy typer then you probably wnna look for another type of switches keyboard since the red ones can cause alot of misspelling
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for FPS and iCUE to control the RGB
customer_reviews.text: Another amazing product from Corsair! I was looking for a TKL (ten key less) keyboard since my mouse kept hitting the corner of my previous full size keyboard as I mainly play FPS games. I needed a mechanical Corsair RGB so that iCUE can control the RGB and TKL. This fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: StevO

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Keyboard! Love Corsair products!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Corsair keyboard fan, but after trying out the Logitech Pro tenkeyless, I almost switched to that or a SteelSeries. But in the end, this was on sale & I picked it up. My previous keyboard was an older K70 RGB & this is night & day better! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mirrorless Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and feel, the keys are what makes this such a great keyboard ill never go back to the clicky style keys again Cons- im not sure if mine was a preowned or not but it did not come in a corsair marked box just some plain original box and parts were already opened but it seems to be super clean and seems to work just fine, other than the odd boxing its 10/10 i love it
customer_reviews.author: robbie moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: The keys feel fantastic. It is a fairly heavy keyboard which I like personally. It feels very well constructed with no flex in the chassis. The lighting has some cool effects, however it is only red lights so know that when purchasing. I love the spacing of the keys and the compact form factor of this keyboard. It has some great features that others in this price range do not such as dedicated volume keys, play/pause/stop etc. as well as a Windows Button Lock key.
customer_reviews.author: Conor L

customer_reviews.title: Percfect Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was just really cool looking when i first seen it, Then when i received it I fell right in love with it. Keys are mechanically loud but not to loud like other mechanical keyboards. Typing feels something to get use to from using Membrane keyboards. Keys register not using to much of force but feel wonderful. I highly enjoy this product and would recommend for a cheap High Quality keyboard. Only thing that shocked me a little is the fact that the LED lights built into the board are bright but only stay red. Other than that i really enjoy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Works great. First time ever gaming with mouse and keyboard and this has not held me back at all. I love it. Color (red only) can be as bright or dim as you want and you can create some lighting patterns in the app as well. Keys click nicely as well, not overly loud.
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Love it for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Really quiet keys compared to brown and blues. They seem to have needed a small break-in period. Keys seemed really tight/stiff but after a few days of use they’ve gotten easier to push. The keyboard itself is great. Has great weight, feel, the chassis is quiet as well. Really like this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a cardboard box, not in the original box, quality is FANTASTIC, this keyboard will pamper like no other keyboard, switching back to a regular keyboard is going to hurt since this keyboard is so soft and gentle with your fingers. rbg is phenomenal and build quality is amazing, a real sturdy keyboard. Software wise is a tough nail, since corsair seems to have issues with compatibility, but this is not a software review. This piece of hardware will change your life even if you're just typing or gaming. A must have
customer_reviews.author: Juancarlord

customer_reviews.title: keycaps sucks
customer_reviews.text: The keycaps are cheap plastic. You can simply buy a new set of quality ones but a few keys on the bottom row are not standard and can't be changed out. Thats my only gripe with the keyboard. It's a nice one.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Wrist rest is too small
customer_reviews.text: The wrist rest is so small that it doesn't even make sense that it's there. If only the wrist rest were the same thickness as the other full size keyboards this would be a fantastic keyboard. Maybe if you have absolutely tiny hands...
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap keyboard for gaming
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this because my old keyboard the Razer huntsman was very loud especially at night, the noise drove me crazy and it's huge, so I bought this bad boy. I didn't expect much when I got it but holy crap does it feel so much better for gaming not typing. When I type with cherry reds sometimes I don't push down all the way so I'm not wasting time and I'll miss a few letters and I won't notice with the huntsman the tactile bump helps a lot at least for me but this is not a bad keyboard at all it's really good for 50 dollars. I genuinely have no problems with this keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Marrero

customer_reviews.title: Good but too expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.text: Now hear me out, the keyboard is a pretty good item. While its small, and the materials seem, at least looking at it from the outside, are all just plastic, it feels great. Now back to the plastic, if im buying something for 80 bucks I want it to look more expensive, just looking at it makes it feel like a 40 dollar keyboard. For the 40-50 range you can get this  Also corsair, looks just better, and it has a wrist rest. For 80 dollars I think I should also get a wrist rest.
customer_reviews.author: aurora

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet
customer_reviews.text: You won't be banging away on this thing during a conference call without someone noticing. I generally prefer some kind of feedback in my keyboards, but these keys have a good feel and I'm a heavy typer anyway. The desk space savings and the crazy lighting effects are an added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: T. Creek

customer_reviews.title: Great response from these Cherry MX, love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the K65 for a couple years and it's been solid. This one is very similar. Same Cherry MX keys. The cord on the K63 is solid but doesn't detach like the K65. The LEDs are very bright. Three brightness settings. I would prefer another step dimmer for dark rooms. Overall this is a great mechanical keyboard and I can easily top 100 wpm. I use it on MacOS. You have to swap the command and option modifier key mapping in System Preferences.
customer_reviews.author: pdx0110

customer_reviews.title: Keys are very cheap
customer_reviews.text: Keys broke off from simple use. Do not buy this spend a bit more for keys that actually stick to the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: This would be my ideal keyboard
customer_reviews.text: A heavy and stable base, it doesn't slide around. Compact, yet it has all the expected keys in the expected places. Sculpted key caps without the sharp corners of some other brands. No numeric keypad lets you keep the mouse closer. Good key travel. This would be my ideal keyboard, but I prefer the blue MX (more clicky) keys. I wish they made this exact model with that option.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh Ray

customer_reviews.title: Pre-Opened.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these keyboards, one came in box perfectly packaged the other came in a stock box already opened with the information missing and extra keys missing also. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Some QA and shipping issues
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard was delivered and some of the keycaps are not intact. Not sure how keycaps can be removed during shipping. Those keycaps can be removed with minimal effort as you can see in the video. The LED on the "previous" button is dim compared the others. Other than that all seems to work okay so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jr

customer_reviews.title: RGB Goodness
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is pretty cool. Can do a bunch of things in iCue. Some games have built in lighting profiles which is fun. I find it comfortable and easy to use. I have the full size of this keyboard and also like it about the same. Would 100% buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Super responsive for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Butter-smooth typing. Elimination of num-pad optimized my workstation ergonomics. Super responsive for gaming. Linux-compatible with CKB. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: barbeerian

customer_reviews.title: Strongly NOT recommended
customer_reviews.text: I usually never write reviews but this time it is a must! I am a happy Corsair fan: - top RGB chassis, - good RGB DIMMs, - excellent mice, BUT this keyboard despite a nice feel has severe Keycaps issues (they pop off from the switches). I am awaiting a super slow RMA of 11 Keycaps after only 3.5 months of use (ETA 3 weeks to Europe). Support is trying to help but I have had it and ordered a replacement Razer Razer BlackWidow TE Chroma v2 and I hope I will get luckier.
customer_reviews.author: MCO

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you ignore the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product, the keys and switches feel premium. The lights look really nice. The software truly is horrible, they make it unnecessarily difficult to customize the colors and for the life of me I can't get my color scheme to stay when the software is off. And the price is high but the keys are amazing and the build is amazing and it's a strong recommendation for me, as long as the things I mentioned don't bother you.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hays

customer_reviews.title: Clicky fun! But for serious typing?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard, I tried them all. This one is sturdy and is doing a great job. I don't know how anybody could type on keyboards like this exclusively. They are so loud. I use an apple keyboard for serious typing because its quiet. But this one is fun for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the most part.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this keyboard was amazing. The linear switches were very easy and smooth to press and the wrist rest was very comfortable. Just one problem, I connect the keyboard to play fortnite but the only lighting I can get is is the original one. Does anybody know how to get full rgb lighting on ps4?
customer_reviews.author: Man

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is made of real quality materials. I was really happy with how they had full media controls even though it was a tenkeyless keyboard. The floating keycap design makes it 5x easier to clean even if it doesn't dampen the noise as well. I wish it was a different color than red, but that's just a personal opinion. Overall it's a great tenkeyless keyboard with media controls and red switches.
customer_reviews.author: dab

customer_reviews.title: So nice.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Very durable and over-built. Sports a 10 key-less design that takes up less desk real-estate. Includes nifty software for programming the LEDS as well as multimedia buttons which make a must have for computer enthusiasts. Keys pop out for easy cleaning. And most importantly, it feels great whether gaming or typing!
customer_reviews.author: Yolo McSwaggins

customer_reviews.title: First mechanical keyboard, very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first buy of a mechanical keyboard. I'm sure I need a different type key, but very dissapointed that all keys are not mechanical. There is no documentation I have found anywhere that warns you that critical (to me) Shift, Enter, BackSpace, and Spacebar keys are not mechanical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I got a very large mousepad to play Rainbow six on and my full length corsair keyboard was taking up too much space on the desk and i would constantly slam my mouse pretty hard into the numberpad part of the keyboard. This keyboard fixed that issue up no problem. No numberpad no slamming! The switches are buttery smooth if you like reds and the red color went perfect with the aesthetic of my desk!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade for me and jesus, was it worth it. I bought a cheap mechanical keyboard and it was okay. It was my first experience with one and I was enjoying it. After 1 year of usage the keyboard started to fail. Keystrokes were registering twice and some keys were starting to come off by themselves. Decided I should upgrade and found the K65 at an affordable price. After trying it...holy moly I was missing out! The keys are like butter cream and the responsiveness is just over the top. In love with it.
customer_reviews.author: Yaro

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. The lighting effects are great, though can be a little difficult to understand at first. I also had to use an older version of the software as the newer version would not seem to run. Other than the slight learning curve, and the issue with my computer I felt that this was a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Blood red keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love the board. Been using for about a month or 2 now, and the size is perfect. The keys feel great to play games/type on and also having media keys is super nice on a small board. The red lighting gets bright and I usually just keep it on the first or 2nd brightness level. iCUE works well but I don't really mess with the different effects
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Decent and saves space.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for work. I write 20 emails a day and code. They feel nice and take up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Nou Phabmixay

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: The mechanical keys are great quality. Had my other one for 3 years gamed on it nearly every day and the keys never failed.(split beer in my old one -reason for replacement) Great weight! Never slides around. The wrist rest makes long session very comfortable as well. All around Corsair makes my favorite keyboards!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gullickson

customer_reviews.title: Are some keys supposed to be taller than others?
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this keyboard and it feels really nice and it's heavy... however I noticed some keys are taller and higher than other keys.. is this suppose to be normal?
customer_reviews.author: andrew oh

customer_reviews.title: 50%-50% to be defective. not recommended
customer_reviews.text: keyboard is nice, aluminium board..pad for your hands.. all these are cool...BUT unfortunately RGB is bad. colors often are stuck in random caps or with low brightness..problems started from first week..after doing a research..corsair RGB keyboards have HUGE problems with RGB colors.. apart from that Amazon sold me a new keyboard...and it was refurbished.. can't tell how many hours I have wasted trying to get a replacement, refund etc.. and got a solution finally after a lot of pressure..stay away from this keyboard because it will probably be defective and amazon is going to give you hard time........
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. the design is beautiful. 6 macros keys that you can program. and full RGB back light control. i do recommend getting this keyboard is you are looking for a new one. The only issue i have with this keyboard is while the system is off. if you hit any of the keys the back light comes on and can not be turned off unless unplugged.
customer_reviews.author: John Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap keyboard. The only problem with it is that it makes a springy sound when hitting certain keys and the corners of the keyboard are sharp enough to commit murder with.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great backlit cherry keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I wish the software was a bit better, but the build quality of this keyboard is great, and it even works on Linux with ckb-next. I also wish it had PBT instead of ABS keycaps.
customer_reviews.author: H.F.

customer_reviews.title: Great price. feelsgood.jpg  Not overly clicky either.
customer_reviews.text: Not too clicky. But definitely can tell the difference between this keyboard and membrane. Night and day I tell you. Knew it didn’t have a num pad when I bought it. And now I hate myself for that. I even read reviews saying that was the only con. If you ever have touched a num pad or plan too, BUY THE NUM PAD VERSION.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The Best 10 keyless keyboard with the best lighting control money can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 10 keyless keyboard layout in my opinion for the price the shift button is the right size and everything the lightening controls is good icue software fails to open on boot sometimes but the hardware is good.. cherry mx silent red ain't that silent but it does feel nice
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this! I was scared it was going to be a rip off and the fact it cost a lot. But it lights up very nice and the buttons function great
customer_reviews.author: Rhea

customer_reviews.title: Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. 3 stars because it Doesnt have media keys and the font is not very professional. Also why are they texturing the spacebar?? I mean other then a few small things its great. Just things I miss from my old corsair lux. Maybe ill swap for the full size.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working and a hard reset doesn't fix it.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned and used the keyboard for just over 6 months. It now doesn't work. Amazon says no product support available. I'll have to reach out to Corsair. Hopefully they fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Keys coming off all the time
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard for my regular daily job which means I use it 10-16hrs a day... and keys keep getting off ( coming off the base) all the time. the arrow the ESC bottom, etc. the just came off so easy... I use to have the big brother of this keyboard I don't remember the name but it was a black metal corsair which last me years until I threw water on it... that one las solid 100% so I bought this one the smaller version, but isn't as good as the large version
customer_reviews.author: Pedro flores

customer_reviews.title: Keys don't stay on!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first mechanical keyboard and I am disappointed to say the least. I bought Corsair thinking it was better quality for gaming but it's not. The keyboard and mouse combo I bought has had nothing but issues. The mouse started double clicking within 2 months of use and the keys keep popping off the keyboard while I am playing. Sad part was it all started happening after I was able to return it for a new product.
customer_reviews.author: PapaDude

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, garbage product. Buyers-Bewhere.
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR: This keyboard is defective and corsair customer service is the absolute worst. The key caps are faulty and break from normal usage. When i contacted customer service to request new key-caps they dismissed the notion that i could as many broken caps as i told them, so they refused to ship replacement caps. Instead they wanted me to put deposit down n wait for them to ship me a new keyboard. I declined.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent responsiveness
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is all of the quality I would expect from Corsair. The switches are fast and responsive. I find that I do not miss the number pad. I wish more premium keyboards were offered at a lower price point without all the frills. If you don't care about programmable RGB and having all the crazy colors, GET THIS KEYBOARD. It's a freakin steal. You can even program cool effects and macros.
customer_reviews.author: cstone

customer_reviews.title: Look out for loose keys!
customer_reviews.text: Its beautiful! Matches my rig and looks damn good. One key was loose out of the box but I pushed it like I was typing and it snapped into place and hasn't been a problem since. I ran through each key like that before plugging it in just to make sure and didn't find any other problems. I love the volume control right on the keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: David Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: One year in, W key is broken
customer_reviews.text: I play games 5-6 hours a week, and this couldn't survive a year. Never felt confident in the feel while gaming. Expected way better from Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Toddzilla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has a great feeling to it! The Corsair program allows you to customize every single key to a different color or lighting pattern and the switches feel great. The build quality is great! You really get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Mister

customer_reviews.title: Great Hardware, Horrible Software
customer_reviews.text: ICUE Software is garbage. You have to create a custom profile and it is extremely difficult to create, edit and upkeep. And if you attach a different mouse or keyboard it causes even more problem. I wish like on logitech devices you could just hold the LED button and press 1-0 for custom presets.
customer_reviews.author: Prophet

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright
customer_reviews.text: I am not a gamer, so I don't know what has value for them. The board is easy to see, even in relatively bright light, and has a noticeable tactile quality. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Neon Doc

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this keyboard for several weeks now since I bought it. Excellent condition. Key presses are smooth and quiet unless you’re typing like a mad man. Quiet enough that you my headset (HyperX Cloud 2) doesn’t pick up any noise unless I’m mashing a key out of frustration. Will suggest to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Sroczynski

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to find a backlit keyboard that did NOT have a 10-key, but that was what we wanted. Good mechanical feel. These are "reds" so there is no bump on the keys. That is a personal preferences issue. Had the set of keys we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Vodil

product_meta.title: Corsair K63 Compact Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - Backlit Red LET - Linear & Quiet - Cherry MX Red
product_meta.description: Style:Keyboard| Color:Red LEDThe Corsair K63 features Cherry MX Red mechanical key switches for ultimate performance. Brilliant red LED backlighting enhances the experience with dynamic and virtually unlimited lighting adjustability. It has a ten keyless design for better mobility and more room on your desktop. Dedicated volume and multimedia controls allow you to adjust your audio without interrupting your game. 100 percent anti-ghosting with full key rollover ensures accuracy, so every keystroke translates directly into accurate gameplay. Harness the power of CUE for sophisticated macro programming and dramatic lighting effects and animations. Compatibility PC with 2 USB 2.0 port, Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, or Windows Vista.
feature_bullets: 100 percentage Cherry MX Red mechanical key switches: Gold contact Cherry MX mechanical gaming key switches deliver the ultimate performance and competitive advantage
Per key red LED backlighting and large font keycaps: Brilliant red LED backlighting enhances the experience with dynamic and virtually unlimited lighting adjustability
Compact, ten keyless design: It's great for travel, and you'll have more room for your mouse
Dedicated volume and multimedia controls: Control to adjust audio on the fly without interrupting your game
100 percentage anti ghosting with full key rollover: No matter how fast you’re in game actions are, your keystrokes always register the way you intended
Note: Software CD not include with the product

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,135 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
